Package org.forgerock.openidm.provisioner.openicf.impl

Class OpenICFProvisionerService

java.lang.Object
org.forgerock.openidm.provisioner.openicf.impl.OpenICFProvisionerService
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.forgerock.json.resource.SingletonResourceProvider, ProvisionerService
public class OpenICFProvisionerService extends Object implements ProvisionerService, org.forgerock.json.resource.SingletonResourceProvider
The OpenICFProvisionerService is the implementation of CollectionResourceProvider interface with OpenICF.

    • getStatus

      public Map<String,Object> getStatus(org.forgerock.services.context.Context context)
      Gets a brief status report about the current status of this service instance.

      An example response when the configuration is enabled { "name" : "ldap", "enabled" : true, "config" : "config/provisioner.openicf/ldap" "objectTypes": [ "group", "account" ], "connectorRef" : { "connectorName": "org.identityconnectors.ldap.LdapConnector", "bundleName": "org.openidentityplatform.openicf.connectors.ldap-connector", "bundleVersion": "[2.0.0.0,3)" } , "ok" : true } An example response when the configuration is disabled { "name": "ldap", "enabled": false, "config": "config/provisioner.openicf/ldap", "objectTypes": [ "group", "account" ], "connectorRef": { "connectorName": "org.identityconnectors.ldap.LdapConnector", "bundleName": "org.openidentityplatform.openicf.connectors.ldap-connector", "bundleVersion": "[2.0.0.0,3)" }, "error": "connector not available", "ok": false }

      Specified by:
      getStatus in interface ProvisionerService
      Parameters:
      context - the Context of the request requesting the status
      Returns:
      a Map of the current status of a connector

    • liveSynchronize

      public org.forgerock.json.JsonValue liveSynchronize(org.forgerock.services.context.Context context, String objectType, org.forgerock.json.JsonValue previousStage) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      This newBuilder and this method can not be scheduled. The call MUST go through the org.forgerock.openidm.provisioner

      Invoked by the scheduler when the scheduler triggers.

      Synchronization object: "connectorData" : "syncToken" : "1305555929000", "nativeType" : "JAVA_TYPE_LONG" , "synchronizationStatus" : { "errorStatus" : null, "lastKnownServer" : "localServer", "lastModDate" : "2011-05-16T14:47:58.587Z", "lastModNum" : 668, "lastPollDate" : "2011-05-16T14:47:52.875Z", "lastStartTime" : "2011-05-16T14:29:07.863Z", "progressMessage" : "SUCCEEDED" } }}

      Synchronise the changes from the end system for the given objectType.

      OpenIDM takes active role in the synchronisation process by asking the end system to get all changed object. Not all systems are capable to fulfill this kind of request but if the end system is capable then the implementation sends each change to a new request on the router and when it is finished, it returns a new stage object.

      The previousStage object is the previously returned value of this method. Unhandled exception will result not to update the stage object in repository.

      All exceptions must be handled to save the the new stage object. Synchronize the changes from the end system for the given objectType.

      OpenIDM takes active role in the synchronization process by asking the end system to get all changed object. Not all systems are capable to fulfill this kind of request but if the end system is capable then the implementation sends each change to a new request on the router and when it is finished, it returns a new stage object.

      The previousStage object is the previously returned value of this method.

      Specified by:
      liveSynchronize in interface ProvisionerService
      Parameters:
      context - the request context associated with the invocation
      previousStage - The previously returned object. If null then it's the first execution.
      Returns:
      The new updated stage object. This will be the previousStage at buildNext call.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the value of connectorData can not be converted to SyncToken.
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the SyncApiOp operation is not implemented in connector.
      org.forgerock.json.JsonValueException - if the previousStage is not Map.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException - if a failure occurred during live sync
